title: 150 Follower Problem!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a) Let there be a square with its vertices on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A(150,150),B(150,-150),C(-150,-150),D(-150,150)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Let A Square WXYZ Be created By Joining the Mid points Of the Sides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB,BC,CD,DA"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find the Area Of WXYZ. Let this Area be a."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b) Let P(x) Be a Quadratic Polynomial, Such That, 
P(1) = 7
P(2)=17
P(3)= 31."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find b where P(b) =b and b is integral."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c) Given, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)={150x}^{150}-{149x}^{149}+{148x}^{148}-.......-x-c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Given, P(-1)=0, Find c."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For the second one what I did was "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F(x)=(x-1)(x-2)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)=F(x) +x(x+7) -1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then let the variable be b"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=F(b)+b(b+7)-1 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the above equation we get.  b= -1 ,-1/2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we only need the integral value of b "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore b= -1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note for the problem poster:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" You need to change your question a bit because, for Q-(b), "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(b)=b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has two solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=(-1),\left(-\frac{1}{2}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". You should add the fact that we need only integral "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For (1):","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using mid-point formula and a diagram, we get that the required square has the vertices "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"W(150,0)~,~X(0,-150)~,~Y(-150,0)~,~Z(0,150)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Now, it is easy to get that the side of the square obtained is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"150\sqrt{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" using distance formula. As such, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=(150\sqrt{2})^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For (2):","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using method of finite differences, construct a difference table for quadratic "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Denote by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D_i(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the value of the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i^{\textrm{th}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" difference column for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We'll get that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D_1(1)=10~,~D_2(1)=4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Hence, using the reconstruction method,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)=P(1)+\sum_{i=1}^2\left(\frac{D_i(1)}{i!}\cdot \prod_{j=1}^i(x-j)\right)=2x^2+4x+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(b)=b\implies 2b^2+3b+1=0\implies (2b+1)(b+1)=0\implies b=(-1),\frac{-1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But we're looking for integral value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=(-1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For (3):","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be written compactly using summation notation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)+c=\sum_{i=1}^{150}(-1)^iix^i\implies P(-1)+c=\sum_{i=1}^{150}1^ii\\ \implies 0+c=\sum_{i=1}^{150}i\implies c=\frac{150\times 151}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we perform a very high level operation on these values, called addition."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c=2\times 150^2-1+\frac{150\times 151}{2}=\boxed{56324}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            | "A very high Level operation on these numbers, Called Addition ""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"LOL ROFL XD XD

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            For Q-2, if one doesn't want to use that "reconstruction method" because it seems too "complicated", they can use an easier way."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Alternative approach (i):","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" From the method of finite differences, we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D_2(1)=4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times the leading coefficient of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Using this, we get that the leading coefficient is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Now, simply use two of the values from the given "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" values and form two equations in terms of unknown coefficients. Then, solve for the remaining two coefficients and get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Alternative approach (ii):","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" A more elementary approach would be to solve for all three unknown coefficients of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by forming three equations in terms of the three unknown coefficients and then using Cramer's rule or Matrix method to solve the system.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Once Again, I will give away the answers, I encourage you to try it again on your own."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a) 45000 Sq. Units"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b) -1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c) 11325."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Adding, We get 56324. Love the answer xD"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cheers!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 150 Followers problem!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A triangle ABC rotates about the side [BC]  and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ABC = 120°"}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the area of of the surface which results from the rotation of the polygonal line formed by the sides [CA] and [AB]  of  |AB| = 2"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\sqrt{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and |BC| = 5,"}]}]}

title: 150 followers problem!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There is a number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{ABCD}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{ABCD}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"="},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{PQRSABCD}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".Then can you tell the only possible value of the four digit number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{ABCD}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Extra credit :prove that this is the only possible answer for a 4 digit number"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Quite an easy one,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We are searching for a 4-digit number whose square also has the same last 4 digits,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we must begin our search from the units digit,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The numbers which have the same units digit after squaring are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0,1,5,6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we extend it ten's digit "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"00,01,25,76"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We observe that possibility of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be units digits are nill, hence we continue with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25,76"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Taking one more step ahead we end up with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"625,376"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And at the final step we observe "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0625"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9376"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{9376}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the answer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
